obfuscation: Oh , 't is you , is it ?
original:
Oh, 'tis you, is
it?

obfuscation: What 're ye shiverin ' 'bout ?
original: What're ye shiverin' 'bout?

obfuscation: Stay by the stove where ye belong and ye 'll find no need of chatterin ' .
original:
Stay by the stove where ye belong and
ye'll find no need of chatterin'.

obfuscation: It 's c-c-cold .
original: It's c-c-cold.

obfuscation: Who d 'ye think it were -- the Old Man ?
original: Who d'ye think it were--the Old Man?

obfuscation: None o ' your lip , new un , or I 'll learn ye .
original:
None o' your
lip, young un, or I'll learn ye.

obfuscation: Where was it ye've been all o ' the time -- the fo'c's'tle ?
original:
Where was it ye've
been all o' the time--the fo'c's'tle?

obfuscation: Yes .
original: Yes.

obfuscation: Let the Old Man see ye up for'ard monkeyshinin ' with the hands and ye 'll get a hidin ' ye 'll not forget in a hurry .
original:
Let the Old Man see ye up for'ard monkeyshinin' with the
hands and ye'll get a hidin' ye'll not forget in a hurry.

obfuscation: Aw , he do n't see nothin ' .
original: Aw, he don't see nothin'.

obfuscation: He jest walks up and down like he did n't notice nobody -- and stares at the ice to the no'the'ard .
original:
He jest walks up and down like he didn't notice nobody--and
stares at the ice to the no'the'ard.

obfuscation: He's constantly starin ' at the ice .
original:
He's
always starin' at the ice.

obfuscation: Ice , ice , ice !
original: Ice, ice, ice!

obfuscation: Damn him and damn the ice !
original: Damn him and damn the ice!

obfuscation: Holdin ' us in for nigh on a year -- nothin ' to see but ice -- stuck in it like a fly in molasses !
original:
Holdin' us in for
nigh on a year--nothin' to see but ice--stuck in it like a fly in
molasses!

obfuscation: Ssshh !
original: Ssshh!

obfuscation: He 'll hear ye .
original: He'll hear ye.

obfuscation: Aye , damn , and damn the Arctic seas , and damn this rotten whalin ' ship of his , and damn me for a fool to ever ship on it !
original:
Aye, damn, and damn the Arctic seas, and damn
this rotten whalin' ship of his, and damn me for a fool to ever ship on
it!

obfuscation: He 's a hard man -- as hard a man as ever sailed the seas .
original:
He's a hard
man--as hard a man as ever sailed the seas.

obfuscation: Aye .
original: Aye.

obfuscation: The two years we all signed up for are done this day !
original: The two years we all signed up for are done this day!

obfuscation: Two years o ' this dog 's life , and no luck in the fishin ' , and the hands half starved with the food runnin ' low , rotten as it is ; and not a sign of him turnin ' back for home !
original:
Two
years o' this dog's life, and no luck in the fishin', and the hands half
starved with the food runnin' low, rotten as it is; and not a sign of
him turnin' back for home!

obfuscation: Home !
original: Home!

obfuscation: I begin to doubt if ever I 'll set foot on land again .
original:
I begin to doubt if ever
I'll set foot on land again.

obfuscation: What is it he thinks he's goin ' to do ?
original:
What is it he thinks he's
goin' to do?

obfuscation: Keep us all up here after our time is worked away till the last man of us is starved to death or frozen ?
original:
Keep us all up here after our time is worked out till the
last man of us is starved to death or frozen?

obfuscation: We 've grub enough hardly to concluding out the voyage back if we started now .
original:
We've grub enough hardly
to last out the voyage back if we started now.

obfuscation: What are the men goin ' to make 'bout it ?
original:
What are the men goin' to
do 'bout it?

obfuscation: Did ye hear any talk in the fo'c's'tle ?
original: Did ye hear any talk in the fo'c's'tle?

obfuscation: They said if he do n't place back south for home to-day they 're goin ' to mutiny .
original:
They said if he don't put
back south for home to-day they're goin' to mutiny.

obfuscation: Mutiny ?
original: Mutiny?

obfuscation: Aye , 't is the only thing they can do ; and serve him properly after the manner he 's treated them -- 's if they were n't no better nor dogs .
original:
Aye, 'tis the only thing
they can do; and serve him right after the manner he's treated them--'s
if they weren't no better nor dogs.

obfuscation: BEN .
original: BEN.

obfuscation: The ice is all broke up to s'uth'ard .
original: The ice is all broke up to s'uth'ard.

obfuscation: They 's clear water s'far 's you can see .
original:
They's clear water s'far 's
you can see.

obfuscation: He ai n't got no excuse for not turnin ' back for home , the men says .
original:
He ain't got no excuse for not turnin' back for home, the
men says.

obfuscation: He wo n't look nowheres but no'the'ard where they 's only the ice to see .
original:
He won't look nowheres but no'the'ard where
they's only the ice to see.

obfuscation: He make n't want to see no clear water .
original: He don't want to see no clear water.

obfuscation: All he thinks on is gettin ' the ile -- 's if it was our fault he ai n't had good luck with the whales .
original:
All he
thinks on is gettin' the ile--'s if it was our fault he ain't had good
luck with the whales.

obfuscation: I think the man 's mighty nigh losin ' his senses .
original:
I think the man's mighty
nigh losin' his senses.

obfuscation: D'you really think he 's crazy ?
original: D'you really think he's crazy?
